snippet: After several years of stopgap financing, a longterm plan will help pay for such items as airport expansion.
abstract: House of Representatives approves $63 billion to pay for federal aviation programs through 2015, acting after five years of dispute and 23 short-term extensions of financing that the Federal Aviation Administration said made it harder to carry out its mandate.
lead_paragraph: After several years of stopgap financing, a longterm plan will help pay for such items as airport expansion.

headline.seo: House Approves Aviation Funds for 4 Years
headline.main: House Approves 4 Years of Funds for Aviation Programs
headline.print_headline: House Approves 4 Years of Funds for Aviation Programs
